185795459.review:
Another example of an MMO that I never really got far into because it's hard to measure up to World of Warcraft.

Probably still pretty fun for a while though.

185326405.review:
"Ragnarok Online 2" is pretty awful... it's basically a World of Warcraft ripoff but incredibly shallow, grindy, and the greed of the developers just insane.

This WoW ripoff has one of the worst UI's imaginable, with crap camera controls and everything else.  It looks like the developers spent more money making the intro animation/advert for this Ragnarok Online inspired WoW ripoff than they did actually making the game.  And that wasted money is something they seem desperate to recover... wait until you see how much they want for all the P2W DLC.

There's only a handful of classes and even less to do with them in the game.. it quickly turns into a grindfest so appalling that it would make mobile devs foam at the mouth with excitement.

This has some really mediocre looking graphics that will understandably be a turn off for a lot of gamers, and it's a big contributor to the failure of the game to attract gamers despite having no up-front cost.  Gaming is a primarily visual medium, and if developers want to succeed, they must understand that it's not an area for compromise.  You deserve better than compromises.

On pricing and value for gamers, this isn't really free as the developers are trying to scam PC gamers out of TWO HUNDRED AND SEVENTEEN UNITED STATES DOLLARS worth of P2W DLC packs... really disgusting monetization.

Bearing in mind that free games don't add +1 to your game collector count, should you bother adding this to your library and downloading it?

Nope.  This isn't worth downloading.  While this didn't cost me any money up front, I still feel ripped off.

184440506.review:
I love games like this. It's old, almost completely dead but still running and still playable. There's something so unsettlingly beautiful about exploring a virtual world that's time has come and gone (if there ever *was* a time) and whose days are likely numbered. The last news update on their website was Feburary 2022 Valentines Day Event. I've only seen 2 other people in the newbie area in the time I've played so far.

As for the game? Movement feels pretty clunky. Tab target combat with lots of downtime for recovery early on, and not many in-game options. It also performs poorly for such an old title. It's also kinda beautiful in that early-mid 2000s anime MMORPG way that's hard to describe. The enemy designs are pretty adorable, if a bit goofy. Not sure why but it's kinda fun to login and poke around for a little while. 

It's free so why not.

183772997.review: Jogo mais "bugado" que já conheci. Para criar senha é uma droga: os números não aparecem. Ao criar o personagem, torna-se pior; Nada fica "clicável". Esse jogo é uma ofensa ao grandioso clássico Ragnarok!
